summary.en: “BRT” most commonly means Bus Rapid Transit, and in texting it can also mean “be right there.”
summary.zh: “BRT”最常见指快速公交系统；在聊天中也可表示“马上到”。

definition.en: Bus Rapid Transit: a public-transport system that uses buses on dedicated lanes (or with priority at signals) to provide faster, more reliable service, often like a “surface subway.”
definition.zh: 快速公交系统：一种公共交通方式，通过专用车道或信号优先等手段让公交更快、更准点，常被称为“地面地铁”。

examples.en: Many cities built BRT lines to reduce traffic and commute times.
examples.zh: 许多城市建设了BRT线路来缓解拥堵、缩短通勤时间。

examples.en: The new BRT corridor has its own lane and off-board payment.
examples.zh: 新的BRT走廊有专用车道，并采用站外付费。

definition.en: (texting/informal) “Be right there”: used to say you will arrive very soon.
definition.zh: （短信/非正式）“马上到”：表示你很快就会到。

extraExplanation: BRT 作为“Bus Rapid Transit”在城市规划/交通领域很常见，特点常包括：专用道、少停靠或“大站快车”、站台式候车（类似地铁站台）、刷卡/扫码站外付费、信号优先等。
在聊天里写作 brt/BRT 表示“be right there”，语气比 “on my way (OMW)” 更强调“很快就到”，但正式场合不建议使用缩写。
